medical_history.chief_complaint: Persistent severe asthma exacerbated by exposure to flour dust at the workplace.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Asthma symptoms have been present for several years, worsening upon return to work after holidays. Respiratory symptoms constantly occurred during work despite high doses of inhaled corticosteroids and montelukast.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Severe persistent asthma as defined by a baseline forced expiratory volume in 1 s (FEV1) of 59% of predicted normal value.
medical_history.social_history: Occupational exposure to flour dust as a baker.
